result.reason: DPI scaling on the remote session is controlled by the remote OS display settings, not the RDP client — this is an RDP protocol limitation, not an mRemoteNG issue
result.approach: No fix needed; DPI scaling must be configured on the remote machine's Windows display settings

attempts.raw_output:
This is a feature request asking for DPI scaling control (e.g., 125%) on the remote RDP session from within mRemoteNG. This is an RDP protocol limitation — the DPI/scaling of the remote session is controlled by the remote OS display settings, not the RDP client. mRemoteNG already exposes resolution settings, but DPI scaling is not an RDP client-side feature.
